localize.title: The New York Times Trends
localize.description: See what's buzzing on The New York Times in your native language

nodes.title: Two-thirds of working parents meet the criteria for parental burnout, a new report says. The nonclinical term means they are so exhausted by the pressure of caring for their children, they feel they have nothing left to give. https://t.co/IWceUCPf6x https://t.co/0kWpY62Zrr
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Jill Biden, the first lady, met with Ukrainian refugees in Romania on Saturday. At a public school in the countryâ€™s capital, she listened to stories from women who fled Russian bombs and visited with children who said their only wish was to return home. https://t.co/Xry3sXJZfC https://t.co/LfSLa9g8J8
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
The Kremlin entered the war in Ukraine expecting a quick and painless victory, predicting that Ukrainians in the east would gladly join its side.

That plan has failed spectacularly. https://t.co/eB4KyQzIv8
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Ukrainian troops, emboldened by weapons supplied by the West, went on the offensive Friday against Russian forces in the northeast, seeking to drive them back from two key cities as the war plunged deeper into a grinding, town-for-town battle. https://t.co/45b1rdCcOi
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: After weeks of investigation, Italian authorities announced late Friday evening that they had impounded a nearly $700 million superyacht, saying that its owner had â€œsignificant economic and business linksâ€ to â€œprominent elements of the Russian government.â€ https://t.co/3oC9s8Pesv
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Mattea Roach ended her â€œJeopardy!â€ streak on Friday, winning 23 straight games and earning $560,983 (plus a $2000 consolation prize for her loss). She is among the showâ€™s winningest regular-season players. https://t.co/0x0InPlX40
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: If the Supreme Court's draft opinion overturning Roe v. Wade becomes final, poor women will feel the brunt of it as some states ban abortion, @sangerkatz tells @AsteadWesley. Listen to their full conversation. https://t.co/shSP0jtFcP https://t.co/vYNh4lJitI
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: A federal judge in San Francisco on Friday dismissed Donald Trumpâ€™s lawsuit against Twitter over the social media companyâ€™s decision to bar him from its platform permanently after the Jan. 6 attack at the U.S. Capitol. https://t.co/numfrtQv9w
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Here's what the U.S. would look like without Roe v. Wade. https://t.co/Cm9NtnutXR https://t.co/PgRkP3B6MX
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: When a new landlord bought their building in the Bronx and threatened to raise rents and kick them out, tenants banded together. They never expected how far they might get: the chance to buy their apartments for $2,500 each. https://t.co/EIz3VZoikU https://t.co/XdysUOZ0u5
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Tesla is covering transportation costs for employees to get out-of-state abortions, according to a report it released on Friday. The company recently moved to Texas, which is home to some of the most restrictive abortion laws in the U.S. https://t.co/eUgaodSemF
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Threatened with rent hikes and eviction, tenants of a Bronx building came together to fight the landlord. Now they are on the cusp of owning the building. https://t.co/Ym2EpmCMNS
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
The top UN human rights official said that her staff had documented scores of cases of Russian forces targeting male civilians around Kyiv.

Some were beaten or executed, and some were taken to detention camps inside Russia and Belarus, the official said. https://t.co/1OrHwObsIz
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
A marble bust was sold for $34.99 at a Goodwill store in Austin, Texas, in 2018. Turns out, it was an actual Roman bust from the late 1st century BC or early 1st century AD.

How it got to Texas remains a mystery. https://t.co/j1uE7tgVf0 https://t.co/yHl5EjKXOf
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Jill Biden is leaving late Thursday for Eastern Europe, where she will visit with Ukrainian refugees displaced by the Russian invasion and tour the Slovakian border with Ukraine. https://t.co/NOU00rAjsl
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Breaking News: U.S. employers added 428,000 jobs in April and average hourly earnings rose 5.5% from a year ago, signs of strength in the labor market.
https://t.co/5tRS98mu7o
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: The number of unruly air passenger incidents reached its lowest level in the U.S. since 2020, a week after a federal judge in Florida struck down a government mask mandate on public transportation, according to FAA data. https://t.co/hZensTzxSo
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
A marble bust was sold for $34.99 at a Goodwill store in Austin, Texas, in 2018. Turns out, it was an actual Roman bust from the late 1st century BC or early 1st century AD.

How it got to Texas remains a mystery.
https://t.co/qo1UYzQ9wx

nodes.title: Breaking News: The FDA said it would limit the use of Johnson & Johnsonâ€™s Covid vaccine, citing safety concerns over a rare blood clotting disorder. https://t.co/9qJIkMG4AV
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Nearly 15 million more people died during the first two years of the pandemic than would have been expected during pre-pandemic times, the WHO found. The previous death count, from countriesâ€™ reporting, was six million. https://t.co/fj6WmdcvLK https://t.co/VCmqsAyaKV
nodes.author: The New York Times

Surprise ğŸ° Bad Bunny just released a new album, "Un Verano Sin Ti."

"The album is very Caribbean, in every sense: with its reggaeton, its mambo, with all those rhythms," he said in an exclusive interview. "And I like it that way." https://t.co/QOagkVhoDZ https://t.co/T12S8G0QA5

nodes.title:
Cinco de Mayo has a history that runs deep and continues to serve as a vehicle conveying Mexican culture, pride and values.

Here are a few things to know about the day.
https://t.co/pKAGVYexDu
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: A Maryland man who died two months after receiving a heart transplant from a genetically altered pig was infected with a virus that the animals are known to carry, according to the surgeon. The infection may have contributed to his death. https://t.co/uAnhhTemO3
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Aleksandr Lukashenko, the authoritarian leader of Belarus and close ally of President Vladimir Putin, said Russiaâ€™s invasion had "dragged on" and called for an end to the "war," using a word that the Kremlin has assiduously avoided. https://t.co/92ywHzHo6Q
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Donald Trump asked his then-defense secretary, Mark Esper, about the possibility of launching missiles into Mexico to â€œdestroy the drug labsâ€ and wipe out the cartels, Esper said in his upcoming memoir. https://t.co/HsaD7M1GQX
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: The U.S. provided targeting information that helped Ukrainian forces locate and strike the flagship of Russiaâ€™s Black Sea fleet last month. https://t.co/pdmluD7yqG
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
The vaquita, a shy porpoise from Mexico with panda-like eyes, is one of the worldâ€™s most endangered animals. Only about 10 remain.

But now thereâ€™s some rare good news about their chance for survival. https://t.co/wV95SMniC3
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
About 150 skulls, with missing teeth and shattered bits of bone, were found in a cave in southern Mexico in 2012.

The police thought it was a gang-related crime scene. But it turns out the killings happened more than 1,000 years ago.
https://t.co/3cTazFiJ8h
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Ukraine made significant gains in the battleground of Kharkiv in recent days, regaining strategic territory around the city. The advance could hinder Moscowâ€™s assault in the eastern Donbas region, analysts said.
https://t.co/cYhJPUqZos
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Karine Jean-Pierre has been named White House press secretary. She will be the first Black woman and the first openly gay person to serve in the role. https://t.co/1HIvotvtM6 https://t.co/g8sXjiLGFW
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Shell, Europeâ€™s largest energy company, reported its biggest ever quarterly profit amid high oil and natural gas prices. The company recorded $9.1 billion in profit in the first three months of the year.
https://t.co/k3leaF2Dbe
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Ads account for roughly 90% of Twitterâ€™s revenue. Numerous advertising executives say theyâ€™re willing to move their money elsewhere, especially if Elon Musk gets rid of the safeguards that allowed Twitter to remove racist rants and conspiracy theories. https://t.co/mT4gF9PIRb
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: A dramatic account of how the Oath Keepers leader, Stewart Rhodes, tried to reach Donald Trump on Jan. 6 with a message that the group could help keep him in power was revealed in federal court. https://t.co/G8MwFS78f1
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Shawn Williams was just 19 when he was falsely accused of a 1993 murder in Brooklyn.

Now, after being freed in 2018, city officials will pay him $10.5 million to settle a federal civil rights suit against a former detective and two other officers. https://t.co/7bVmlTE5al
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Breaking News: Nearly 15 million more people than expected died during the pandemic, the WHO said, far exceeding Covid tolls reported by countries.
https://t.co/GpDiu2tizK
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Elon Musk grew up in elite white communities in South Africa, detached from apartheidâ€™s atrocities and surrounded by anti-Black propaganda.

He sees his takeover of Twitter as a free speech win but in his youth did not suffer the effects of misinformation. https://t.co/bciCJDWGGP
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: A growing number of White House Correspondents Dinner attendees have tested positive for Covid, including Secretary of State Antony Blinken. https://t.co/sadG6f9b0S
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: The Federal Reserve raised interest rates by half a percentage point, its largest move since 2000, as it tries to tame rapid inflation. https://t.co/o3jHahEjt1
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Gov. Gavin Newsom vowed to protect the right to abortion in California and issued an impassioned â€œwake-up callâ€ to the Democratic Party about what he described as a coordinated Republican-led effort to erode rights. https://t.co/vcl8TZEoF9
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
The resistance to Russiaâ€™s invasion will rank as â€œUkraineâ€™s finest hour,â€ Prime Minister Boris Johnson of Britain said, invoking Winston Churchill, in the first address by a foreign leader to the Ukrainian Parliament since the war began.
https://t.co/ywLnjL2w4u https://t.co/QIw84itW2d
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: The U.S. has provided intelligence that has helped Ukraine target and kill many Russian generals who have died in the war, officials said. https://t.co/QwzcL9B7Yd
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Germany will offer visas and job opportunities to Russians seeking to get away from Vladimir Putinâ€™s government, the German economy minister said, describing measures similar to those Berlin has laid out for Ukrainian refugees.
https://t.co/YGVy5VmCjw
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Young children who transition to a new gender with social changes â€” taking on new names, pronouns and clothing â€” are likely to continue identifying as that gender five years later, according to a report. Participants transitioned, on average, at age 6.5. https://t.co/ywsKaYvGn5
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Bolivian river dolphins were photographed with an anaconda in their mouths in August 2021. The aroused males could have been having a sexual romp with each other before the snake became entangled. https://t.co/wOyrIe6CUL https://t.co/tADtnIbPWv
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: The man who tackled Dave Chappelle onstage during his standup act at the Hollywood Bowl was armed with a fake gun that contained a blade, according to the police. He was charged with assault with a deadly weapon, the Los Angeles Police Department said. https://t.co/apiEwU3Qcq
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: The next round of sanctions against Russia will include Patriarch Kirill of Moscow over his support of the Kremlin's invasion of Ukraine, according to diplomats who reviewed the document but were not authorized to speak publicly. https://t.co/fJxqE2y3P8
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Dolly Parton was voted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame, though she had asked not to be included, as were Eminem, Lionel Richie, Carly Simon, Eurythmics, Duran Duran and Pat Benatar.
https://t.co/2mGKVbrcFt https://t.co/Kj5pHzt2TB
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: The comedian Dave Chappelle was tackled onstage as he performed at the Hollywood Bowl in Los Angeles, according to witnesses and videos. Footage circulating on social media appeared to show a man charging into Chappelle. https://t.co/hwlbL2T5Ej
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Three survivors of the 1921 massacre that saw a white mob kill hundreds of Black residents in Tulsa can proceed with part of a lawsuit seeking reparations, an Oklahoma judge ruled. â€œHistory was made today,â€ a lawyer for the plaintiffs said. https://t.co/2WAbR82iNx
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: Stanford University will receive a record $1.1 billion gift from the venture capitalist John Doerr to fund a school focused on climate change and sustainability. https://t.co/HIzxTTHXbs
nodes.author: The New York Times
